subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: EVP--Ann
author: Robin Searcy Henson
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_0039_01C86D8B.16BFA800
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Ann, I'm seeing this post two weeks after it was sent but wanted to thank y=
ou for the pep talk.  I need it!  The DVD remote makes me cry too..  I just=
 can't understand why everything has to be so complicated and why my kids a=
nd husband don't have the problems I have.  I've been carrying my two hacke=
d radios and digital recorder everywhere with me but have not sat down to s=
eriously attempt a session yet.  I work three days a week out of state and =
tonight am planning to camp out in my car in a remote place so I can really=
 be alone with the equipment.  Do you think it would help for me to send ou=
t verbal or mental messages that I'm hoping to make contact but don't know =
where I'll be yet?  

Robin


  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Lisby=
<mailto:lisby@...> 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com<mailto:EVP-ITC@=
yahoogroups.com> 
  Sent: Wednesday, January 30, 2008 4:44 PM
  Subject: Re=
: [EVP-ITC] Re: EVP


  Robin, you can do it. It took me ages and about $90=
0, but I finally got it all together and its running well. I am a technical=
 as an onion. I can't operate the DVD remote without tears. But I hung in t=
here--and you must, too. This is a massively rewarding experience and I can=
't wait to see what you get and who you get it from. :) 



  Ann


  On Ja=
n 30, 2008, at 7:03 PM, Robin Searcy Henson wrote:




    Thanks LC.  I'm =
going to listen to your recordings tonight when I get home.  I'm intrigued =
by the box research and anxious to get started, but frustrated that I'm not=
 mechanically inclined.  I think you may be onto something with regard to p=
eople having individual roles to play, and you must feel so inspired by the=
 messages you've received.

    Robin


      ----- Original Message -----
=
      From: LC Duplatt<mailto:lcdupla@...>
      To: EVP-ITC@yahoogro=
ups.com<mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com>
      Sent: Wednesday, January 30, =
2008 6:37 AM
      Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: EVP


      Robin,

      I uploa=
ded some of my recordings that indicate a bigger picture.

      Some of th=
e messages say there are "many spirits here," spirit rescue 
      is "very=
 important," etc. You can go through them under LC's folder.

      Last Fr=
iday, I recorded with respect to 2008, "psychic event" 
      and "universa=
l shift." That would indicate that there is a bigger 
      thing going dow=
n, in my opinion. However, I also acknowledge that 
      people here may h=
ave different callings/messages/uses other than what 
      I am hearing. I=
 am going to just follow where the path before me 
      leads and try to f=
ind my role in it.

      Personally, I think this needs to be in many peop=
le's hands. That's 
      an interest of mine, too. Not sure yet how it wil=
l happen, but the 
      radio hacks are a nice start. 

      LC

      --=
- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com<mailto:EVP-ITC%40yahoogroups.com>, "Robin Sear=
cy Henson" 
      <MudPuddleFarm@...> wrote:
      >
      > I haven't star=
ted box recording yet. My impression of the EVP I've 
      captured (which=
 has been almost entirely obtained on the property I 
      moved to six ye=
ars ago) is that someone is attached to this place. 
      The first messag=
e was "Here come some people," as I was hiking up the 
      hill one day w=
ith my goats, then a kill-you threat in the house, 
      then "get out of =
here" in the barn. I assumed it must be one of the 
      original owners, =
and I still feel that it's mainly one spirit 
      communicating that this=
 is their home, not mine. I've gotten one 
      uplifting message from wha=
t I believe to be the same entity, and this 
      is also the last recordi=
ng I've gotten. I asked what death is like, 
      compared to life: happy,=
 beautiful, fulfilling--and specifically if 
      death is less depressing=
. The response was "It's everything." 
      S/he/it basically stopped talk=
ing after that, and I stopped trying. 
      I know this sounds weird, but =
I miss whoever or whatever it was. I 
      wonder if some of us might be b=
etter at dealing with the low-life 
      stuck or grounded entities rather=
 than the highly evolved technicians 
      coming through the more sophist=
icated equipment. I wonder where this 
      is all going ultimately, other=
 than to prove communication across the 
      veil is possible. I'm not an=
 engineer or technologist on this 
      physical plane, and I question wha=
t I have to offer this research 
      since I'm so electronically challeng=
ed. Meanwhile, the nurse side of 
      me wants to heal and "fix" anyone n=
eeding help, even if they happen 
      to be in the next world! Do the gui=
des and technicians ever 
      acknowledge or make reference to the earthb=
ound spirits, and if so, 
      in what context? Are we ever able to help u=
nstick the stuck ones? 
      Are we supposed to ignore them? 
      > 
   =
   > Robin
      > 
      > 
      > ----- Original Message ----- 
      > =
From: LC Duplatt<mailto:lcdupla@...> 
      > To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com<m=
ailto:EVP-ITC%40yahoogroups.com><mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com<mailto:EVP-=
ITC%40yahoogroups.com>> 
      > Sent: Tuesday, January 29, 2008 3:32 AM
  =
    > Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: EVP
      > 
      > 
      > EVP:
      > 
  =
    > Not that this is always the case, but EVP seems to primarily 
      c=
apture 
      > lost people - ghosts being recorded, versus the box having =
the 
      > ability to capture primarily what seems to be higher 
      co=
mmunication 
      > from spirits, (and less of the lower communication - g=
hosts 
      jumping 
      > in).
      > 
      > That to me is a huge di=
fference... ;)
      > 
      > LC
      > http://www.AngelsGhosts.com<http=
://www.angelsghosts.com/><http://www.angelsghosts.com/<http://www.angelsgho=
sts.com/>>

0yahoogroups.com><mailto:EVP-<mailto:EVP->ITC%
      40yahoogroups.com>, "e=
cuyler" <ecuyler@> wrote:
      > >
      > > I agree about the difference =
also. All that review time makes 
      for a
      > > very tedious few ho=
urs. By the end of it you're ready to pull 
      your
      > > hair out. =
I've only done two sessions now and have gotten more
      > > positive res=
ults in 20 minutes time as I have in 10 years of 
      EVP 
      > resear=
ch.
      > > 
      > > Jeremy
      > > 
      > > 
      > > 
      > > =

      > > 
      > > 
      > > 
      > > --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com<=
mailto:EVP-ITC%40yahoogroups.com><mailto:EVP-<mailto:EVP->ITC%
      40yaho=
ogroups.com>, Lisby <lisby@> wrote:
      > > >
      > > > Very interested=
. And I agree with you about the overnight 
      > change. 
      > > > Or=
gs like AA-EVP that aren't dealing with the boxes are 
      missing 
     =
 > the 
      > > > boat.
      > > > 
      > > > Ann
      > > > 
      >=
 > > On Jan 28, 2008, at 8:48 PM, Jules wrote:
      > > > 
      > > > > W=
ell guys, I have to tell you that since I started box 
      sessions 
    =
  > in
      > > > > November I have become so spoiled that conventional EV=
P 
      just 
      > don't do
      > > > > it for me.
      > > > >
    =
  > > > > My organization was asked to come and do an investigation 
      =
at a 
      > very
      > > > > historial place (here in Illinois). The ow=
ner of this home 
      > asked if I
      > > > > would bring one of the b=
oxes to the home (he is amazed with 
      the
      > > > > immediately 2 =
way communication). So upon respectfully 
      asking 
      > my tec
    =
  > > > > if it was alright to do a session outside the my home we 
      d=
id 
      > several
      > > > > box sessions along with conventional EVP.=
 We wanted to see 
      if 
      > we could
      > > > > discover some u=
nanswered history about the residence, and 
      the 
      > > > > others=
ide
      > > > > was more than willing to comply.
      > > > >
      > > =
> > I have to tell you that the regular EVP recordings were and 
      are =

      > the
      > > > > most boring data to review. Something I use to l=
ove so much 
      has
      > > > > actually turned into a project given I=
 am waiting for a 
      response
      > > > > immediately! Too funny how =
things can change overnight!
      > > > >
      > > > > I will be uploadin=
g some files for these sessions if you 
      are 
      > > > > interested=
.
      > > > >
      > > > > Juli
      > > > >
      > > > >
      > > > =
>
      > > >
      > >
